description: Demolition of three existing garages and erection of a single storey one bedroom house with associated amenity space and cycle and refuse storage
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Site Plan, Section, North West Elevation, Proposed Site Plan, Location Plan, Drainage Assessment Form, Flood Risk Assessment and Drainage Statement, South West Elevation, South East (Front) Elevation and North East Elevation. Received on 07/01/2022; Building Performance, Cover Letter, Design and Access Statement, Energy and Sustainability Statement, Fire Strategy Site Plan, Planning Statement, Planning Fire Safety Statement, Transport Statement and SAP Worksheets. Received on 02/03/2022; Proposed Floor Plan Rev A, Proposed Roof Plan Rev A, Proposed Elevation - South West (Flank) Rev A, Proposed Elevation - North East (Flank) Rev A, Proposed Elevation - North West (Rear) Rev A, Proposed Elevations - South East (Front) Rev A and Proposed Section Rev A. Received on 18/05/2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development the boundary treatment as shown in the Design and Access Statement received on 2nd March 2022 and Proposed Elevation South East (Front) Rev A and Proposed Elevation - North East (Flank) Rev A received on 18th May 2022 shall be erected in strict accordance with the approved plans.

Condition : 5 - Prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development the hard and soft landscaping proposals shown in the Design and Access Statement received on 2nd March 2022 and on the Proposed Floor Plan Rev A, Proposed Roof Plan Rev A and Proposed Site Plan received on 18th May 2022 shall be carried out in strict accordance with the approved plans.

Any plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the hereby approved development or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 7 - The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, performance data for energy consumption must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The performance data shall be submitted every 18 months to a monitoring web-platform for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 9 - The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:

At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.

At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.

No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 11 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Prior to any demolition and construction work, neighbours shall be given details outlining construction timeframes (including when demolition and piling will take place).

Condition : 12 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access to the garages adjacent to 86 Beech Avenue shall be permanently closed and kerbs and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Condition : 13 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved development, secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than two bicycles) for the occupants of the dwelling shall be made available for use in accordance with the West London Cycle Parking Guidance and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 14 - Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, the waste and recycling stores shown on the Proposed Floor Plan Rev A, Proposed Site Plan and Proposed Roof Plan Rev A drawings shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 15 - Before the development hereby permitted commences:
(a)	Details of an intrusive site investigation are required in addition to the phase 1 desk study previously submitted. These details shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be investigated by a competent person to identify the extent and nature of contamination. The report should include a tiered risk assessment of the contamination based on the proposed end use of the site. Additional investigation may be required where it is deemed necessary.
(b)	If required, a scheme for decontamination of the site shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, for written approval. The scheme shall account for any comments made by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is first occupied.
During the course of the development:
(c)	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues. 
Before the development is first brought into use:
(d)	The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 16 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant shall have submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing a final detailed drainage design, including drawings and supporting calculations [and an updated Drainage Assessment Form] to be reviewed and approved by the Lead Local Flood Authority. The drainage hierarchy shall make use of green infrastructure technology or evidence that is not possible to comply with the hierarchy set out in London Plan Policy SI3 and the runoff rate should not exceed 1.4 litres/second. A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components shall also be submitted and approved which demonstrates how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details.

Condition : 17 - No part of the development hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Condition : 18 - a) The cumulative measured or calculated rating level of noise emitted from the mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the mechanical system etc operates. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or 1 meter from the facade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance to the latest British Standard 4142; An alternative position for assessment /measurement may be used to allow ease of access, this must be shown on a map and noise propagation calculations detailed to show how the design criteria is achieved.

b) The plant shall be isolated on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts to prevent the structural transmission of vibration and regenerated noise within adjacent or adjoining premises, and these shall be so maintained thereafter.

c) Following installation of any mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, a post completion noise assessment shall be submitted for approval to the local planning authority which demonstrates the actual measured rating level of plant operating under normal conditions. All measurements shall be made in accordance with the methodology of BS4142: 2014(Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound) and/or its subsequent amendments. The post completion report shall be both completed and submitted to the local authority within 28 days of completion of the installation for review.

Condition : 19 - Prior to occupation, the development shall achieve 'Secured by Design' accreditation awarded by the Design-Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (ACPO).

No part of the dwelling shall be occupied until accreditation has been achieved and evidence of such accreditation has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority.
